Definition at line 318 of file ReferenceCountedArray.h.

template<class T>
ReferenceCountedArray< T >::ReferenceCountedArray ( const size_t  newSize  )  [inline, explicit]

Create an empty String container with at least the specified bytes in size.

Parameters:
newSize Reserve at least this many bytes for this String.
Postcondition:
This string's memory will also never be shrunk.

A buffer has been created.

The idea behind this is that if a specific size was asked for, the buffer is like a char buf[N];

Definition at line 328 of file ReferenceCountedArray.h.

template<class T>
virtual ReferenceCountedArray< T >::~ReferenceCountedArray (  )  [inline, virtual]

Array Destructor.

Postcondition:
If the Array's Reference is not shared, it is free'd.

If the Array's Reference IS shared, it is decremented and detached.

template<class T>
void ReferenceCountedArray< T >::append ( const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca,
int  n = -1 
) [inline]

Appends given rca to the end of buffer.

Parameters:
rca The rca to be appended.
n How many characters to copy from the ReferenceCountedArray object.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated. This is the same as inserting the rca at the end of the buffer.

Definition at line 598 of file ReferenceCountedArray.h.

template<class T>
void ReferenceCountedArray< T >::append ( const_reference  item  )  [inline]

Appends one item to end of buffer.

Parameters:
item The item to be appended.
Postcondition:
The buffer is allocated.

The item is appended at the end of the buffer. This is the same as inserting the item at the end of the buffer.

template<class T>
void ReferenceCountedArray< T >::insert ( int  k,
const_reference  item 
) [inline]

Insert an item at the given index.

Parameters:
k The index to insert at.
item The item to be inserted.
Postcondition:
A buffer is allocated.

If the old buffer was too small, it is enlarged.

The item is inserted at the given index.

template<class T>
const ReferenceCountedArray& ReferenceCountedArray< T >::operator= ( const_reference  item  )  [inline]

Sets our buffer to the given item.

Parameters:
item The item to set our buffer to.
Postcondition:
The old buffer (if we had one) is free'd.

A sufficiently sized new buffer is made with the item within.

Returns:
The new array object.

Definition at line 365 of file ReferenceCountedArray.h.

template<class T>
const ReferenceCountedArray& ReferenceCountedArray< T >::operator= ( const ReferenceCountedArray< T > &  rca  )  [inline]

Sets our Reference to the given String reference.

Parameters:
rca The String object to reference.
Postcondition:
The old buffer (if we had one) is free'd.

Our Reference now points to the given String.

Our old rca object has been deleted (disconnected).

Returns:
The new rca object. This handles self-assignment just fine, checking for it explicitly would be ineffecient for most cases.

Return a new array from a subarray.

Returns:
a new ReferenceCountedArray
Parameters:
